physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Urticaria, angioedema, rhinoconjunctivitis, dyspnea, wheezing, abdominal pain, diarrhea, and sickness after azufaifa consumption.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Symptoms improved progressively after treatment with subcutaneous epinephrine and intravenous corticosteroids and antihistamines, subsiding 24 hours later.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Total IgE: 4.89 k m/l; Provocation test showed 15% fall in FEV1 at 1 h, 20% at 4 h.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Normal physical examination and routine laboratory parameters. Negative skin prick tests for latex, disinfectants, and common allergens. Histamine provocation test showed unremarkable bronchial hyperreactivity.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Significant increase in lymphocytes and neutrophils in bronchoalveolar lavage fluid observed, especially at 18 h after the mitoxantrone challenge, with eosinophil influx increasing to 4%.
